qas.question: What type of animals took longer to reestablish?
When did recovery of these diverse animals begin?
How long after the Permian-Triassic extinction did animal recovery take to completion?
What dominated animal life in the Triassic?
How many years after the extinction did animal recovery begin?
What type of animals were especially quick to reestablish?
The recovery of many species failed during what period of the Triassic?
What animal life was most at risk in the Triassic?
How many years of recovery did the extinction interrupt?

context: Recent research indicates that the <a0_0><b5_0>specialized animals<b5_0/><a0_0/> that formed complex ecosystems, with high biodiversity, complex food webs and a variety of niches, took much longer to reestablish, recovery did not begin until the start of the <a1_0><b6_0>mid<b6_0/>-Triassic<a1_0/>, <a4_0><b8_0>4M to 6M<b8_0/><a4_0/> years after the extinction and was not complete until <a2_0>30M years<a2_0/> after the Permian–Triassic extinction event. Animal life was then dominated by various archosaurian <a3_0><b7_0>reptiles<b7_0/><a3_0/>: dinosaurs, pterosaurs, and aquatic reptiles such as ichthyosaurs, plesiosaurs, and mosasaurs.
